summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing the handling of three 2TB external hard drives (HDs) related to the Epstein case. The emails coordinate the drop-off and forensic examination of the drives, with instructions to organize files by device in separate folders. The document is marked as subject to a protective order.

persons.name: Seamus
persons.context: Mentioned in an email as someone who is 'on top of this' regarding the handling of external hard drives.

events.title: Coordination of Epstein Hard Drive Examination
events.description: FBI personnel coordinate the drop-off and forensic examination of three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case, with instructions to organize files by device.

keyFacts: Three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case were being handled by FBI forensic examiners in New York on October 9, 2020.
The email chain includes a request from SDNY (Southern District of New York) prosecutors to organize files from each device in its own folder.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
The correspondence shows coordination between FBI personnel, including a Senior Forensic Examiner and CART Coordinator, for forensic analysis.
The subject line explicitly references 'Epstein HDs', indicating the hard drives are evidence in the Epstein investigation.
